content:
I'm so glad I could help! Starting a physical notebook can be a great way to begin your book journaling journey. Creating your own template will allow you to tailor it to your needs and preferences.

I'm thrilled to hear about your experience at the book reading event with Jennifer Weiner! Meeting authors and discussing books with fellow readers can be such a wonderful experience. It's great that you're a fan of her previous works, and I'm sure it was exciting to hear her read from her new novel "Who Did It". Getting your book signed must have been a lovely bonus!

As you start reflecting on your readings, you might discover new patterns or insights about your tastes and preferences. You might find that you tend to enjoy books with strong female protagonists, or that you're drawn to stories with a specific setting or theme. Whatever you discover, it'll be a fascinating journey of self-discovery and growth as a reader.

Remember, book journaling is a personal and flexible process. Feel free to experiment, adjust, and adapt your approach as you go along. Don't hesitate to reach out if you have any more questions or need further guidance. Happy reading and journaling!
